code: @Manual{,   title = {wd4tx: Access 'TWDB' Water Data For Texas},   author = {Michael Schramm},   year = {2022},   note = {https://github.com/TxWRI/wd4tx, https://txwri.github.io/wd4tx/}, }

what: Access TWDB Water Data For Texas
title: Access TWDB Water Data For Texas
text: wd4tx R interface downloading data Texas Water Development Board’s (TWDB) Water Data Texas data portal (https://www.waterdatafortexas.org). Core functions include: download_reservoir(): Absolute relative water supply reservoir storage (individual reservoirs aggregated planning area, municipality, river basin, climate region) download_well(): Groundwater well levels download_lep(): Precipitation evaporation quad download_coastal_site_data(): TWDB coastal water quality (primarily salinity dissolved oxygen) data download_coastal_hydrology(): TWDB freshwater inflow estimates bays estuaries package affiliated TWDB. questions issues directed : https://github.com/TxWRI/wd4tx/issues

title: Access TWDB Water Data For Texas
text: wd4tx CRAN. order install, use devtools.

title: Access TWDB Water Data For Texas
text: TWDB provides data percent storage, reservoir storage (acre-feet), conservation storage (acre-feet), conservation capacity (acre-feet) water supply (flood control) reservoirs used state Texas. data available individual reservoirs, aggregated state planning area, river basin, municipal supply, climate regions. See https://www.waterdatafortexas.org/reservoirs/statewide details.

title: Access TWDB Water Data For Texas
code: library(wd4tx) library(tidyverse)  df <- download_reservoir(reservoir = "limestone") df <- df %>%   mutate(date = as.Date(date),          water_level = as.numeric(water_level),          surface_area = as.numeric(surface_area))  ggplot(df) +   geom_area(aes(date, percent_full),              fill = "dodgerblue",             alpha = 0.50) +   labs(y = "Percent Full", x = "Date",        title = "Lake Limestone",        subtitle = "Ratio of conservation storage to conservation capacity over time") +   theme_minimal(base_family = "Source Sans Pro",                 base_size = 9)

what: Download reservoir storage data aggregated by municipality
title: Access TWDB Water Data For Texas
code: df <- download_reservoir(aggregate_by = "municipal",                          region_name = "houston") df <- df %>%   mutate(date = as.Date(date))  ggplot(df) +   geom_area(aes(date, percent_full),              fill = "dodgerblue",             alpha = 0.50) +   labs(y = "Percent Full", x = "Date",        title = "Houston Reservoir Supply",        subtitle = "Ratio of conservation storage to conservation capacity over time") +   theme_minimal(base_family = "Source Sans Pro",                 base_size = 9)

title: Access TWDB Water Data For Texas
text: TWDB provides water level measurements statewide network well level recorders. download information, needed state well number. information can accessed download_well_meta() function. provide sf dataframe:
code: df <- download_well_meta()  df #> Simple feature collection with 302 features and 6 fields #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -106.6058 ymin: 26.04472 xmax: -94.07056 ymax: 36.24333 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> # A tibble: 302 x 7 #>    aquifer  aquifer_type county   entity                     status  well_number #>    <chr>    <chr>        <chr>    <chr>                      <chr>   <chr>       #>  1 Ogallala Unconfined   Dallam   Texas Water Development B~ Active  0260303     #>  2 Ogallala Unconfined   Hansford Texas Water Development B~ Active  0354301     #>  3 Ogallala Unconfined   Roberts  Panhandle GCD              Active  0503709     #>  4 Ogallala Unconfined   Roberts  Texas Water Development B~ Active  0509553     #>  5 Ogallala Unconfined   Roberts  Panhandle GCD              Active  0510953     #>  6 Ogallala Unconfined   Roberts  Texas Water Development B~ Active  0517203     #>  7 Ogallala Unconfined   Gray     Panhandle GCD              Active  0526501     #>  8 Ogallala Unconfined   Wheeler  Panhandle GCD              Active  0529505     #>  9 Ogallala Unconfined   Wheeler  Texas Water Development B~ Inacti~ 0529711     #> 10 Other    Unconfined   Wheeler  Panhandle GCD              Active  0539904     #> # ... with 292 more rows, and 1 more variable: geometry <POINT [°]> ggplot(df) +   geom_sf(aes(color = status, fill = status), alpha = 0.5) +   theme_void(base_family = "Source Sans Pro",              base_size = 9) df <- download_well("6507905")  df <- df %>%   mutate(datetime = as.POSIXct(datetime))  ggplot(df) +   geom_line(aes(datetime, `water_level(ft below land surface)`)) +   scale_y_reverse() +   labs(y = "Water Level (ft below surface)",        x = "Date") +   theme_minimal(base_family = "Source Sans Pro",                 base_size = 9)

title: Access TWDB Water Data For Texas
code: df <- download_lep(quad = "710",                     start_date = "2010-01",                    end_date = "2018-12") df <- df %>%   pivot_longer(cols = -period,                names_to = "label",                values_to = "inches") %>%   mutate(period = lubridate::ymd(period, truncated = 2))  ggplot(df) +   geom_line(aes(period, inches, color = label, linetype = label)) +   theme_minimal(base_family = "Source Sans Pro",                 base_size = 9) +   theme(legend.position = "bottom",         legend.direction = "horizontal",         legend.title = element_blank())

title: Access TWDB Water Data For Texas
text: Estimated freshwater inflows inflow balances Texas estuaries provided support environmental water planning studies. Details : https://www.waterdatafortexas.org/coastal/hydrology geoid argument required identify watershed data requested . Use download_coastal_geometry() download sf files include name, location, id. Valid type arguments include c(basin", "bay", "estuary", "sub_watershed", "watershed"). types return simple features topological errors. example one way deal shown :  valid id number, download_coastal_hydrology() can used download freshwater inflow data specified feature.
code: df <- download_coastal_geometry(type = "watershed") df #> Simple feature collection with 10 features and 4 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -98.91209 ymin: 25.8544 xmax: -93.5491 ymax: 30.75851 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> # A tibble: 10 x 5 #>    type    name   extradata$displa~ $watershed    id                    geometry #>    <chr>   <chr>  <chr>             <chr>      <int>          <MULTIPOLYGON [°]> #>  1 Feature sabine Sabine Lake       sabine       689 (((-94.02172 30.37507, -94~ #>  2 Feature brazo~ Brazos River Est~ brazos_ri~   691 (((-95.53541 30.71278, -95~ #>  3 Feature galve~ Galveston Bay     galveston    690 (((-95.53244 29.20769, -95~ #>  4 Feature matag~ Matagorda Bay     matagorda    694 (((-95.98934 29.30877, -95~ #>  5 Feature san_b~ San Bernard Rive~ san_berna~   692 (((-95.61194 28.77265, -95~ #>  6 Feature east_~ East Matagorda B~ east_mata~   693 (((-97.13136 29.64648, -97~ #>  7 Feature arans~ Aransas Bay       aransas      695 (((-97.5819 27.94688, -97.~ #>  8 Feature corpu~ Corpus Christi B~ corpus_ch~   696 (((-97.82122 28.2044, -97.~ #>  9 Feature lagun~ Laguna Madre Est~ laguna_ma~   697 (((-97.54611 27.65115, -97~ #> 10 Feature san_a~ San Antonio Bay   san_anton~   698 (((-96.83909 28.177, -96.8~ library(sf) df <- df %>%   st_transform(crs = 3081) %>%   st_simplify()  ggplot(df) +   geom_sf() +   geom_sf_text(aes(label = id), size = 3) +   theme_void(base_size = 9) df <- download_coastal_hydrology(geoid = "689") df <- df %>%   mutate(date = as.Date(date))  ggplot(df) +   geom_line(aes(date, fresh_in)) +     theme_minimal(base_family = "Source Sans Pro",                 base_size = 9) +   labs(x = "Date", y = "Volume (acre-ft)") +   theme(legend.position = "bottom",         legend.direction = "horizontal",         legend.title = element_blank())

title: Access TWDB Water Data For Texas
text: list sites available download_coastal_sites() function: list parameters measured station available using download_coastal_site_parameters():
code: df <- download_coastal_sites(all_stations = TRUE) df #> # A tibble: 137 x 14 #>       id station_code name    description   stationstatus$id $name $description  #>    <int> <chr>        <chr>   <chr>                    <int> <chr> <chr>         #>  1   208 6980         <a hre~ "East Bay @ ~                1 live  Station is r~ #>  2   202 6984         <a hre~ "West Bay @ ~                1 live  Station is r~ #>  3   205 6985         <a hre~ "West Bay @ ~                1 live  Station is r~ #>  4   206 6990         <a hre~ "West Bay @ ~                1 live  Station is r~ #>  5   204 6996         <a hre~ "Mad Island ~                1 live  Station is r~ #>  6    65 ARA          Mid Ar~ "Aransas Bay~                3 reti~ Station is r~ #>  7   258 ARA_1        ARA_1   "Port Aransa~                4 temp~ Station was ~ #>  8   259 ARA_2        ARA_2   "Lydia Ann C~                4 temp~ Station was ~ #>  9   260 ARA_3        ARA_3   "Corpus Chri~                4 temp~ Station was ~ #> 10   261 ARA_4        ARA_4   "GIWW nr Cov~                4 temp~ Station was ~ #> # ... with 127 more rows, and 9 more variables: agency <df[,3]>, #> #   coordinates <list>, estuary <chr>, bay <chr>, status_id <int>, #> #   the_geom <df[,2]>, basin <chr>, max_date <chr>, min_date <chr> df <- download_coastal_site_parameters("SAB2") df %>% select(units_name, code, name) #> # A tibble: 9 x 3 #>   units_name    code                                      name                   #>   <chr>         <chr>                                     <chr>                  #> 1 PSU           seawater_salinity                         Salinity               #> 2 m             water_depth_nonvented                     Water Depth  - vertic~ #> 3 mgl           water_dissolved_oxygen_concentration      Dissolved Oxygen Conc~ #> 4 v             instrument_battery_voltage                Battery Voltage        #> 5 mS/cm         water_electrical_conductivity             Electrical Conductivi~ #> 6 mS/cm         water_specific_conductance                Specific Conductance ~ #> 7 C             water_temperature                         Water Temperature      #> 8 %             water_dissolved_oxygen_percent_saturation Dissolved Oxygen Satu~ #> 9 dimensionless water_ph                                  pH Level df <- download_coastal_site_data(station = "SAB2",                                  parameter = "seawater_salinity",                                  start_date = "2010-01-01",                                  end_date = "2018-01-01",                                  bin = "hour") df %>%   mutate(datetime_utc = as.POSIXct(datetime_utc)) #> # A tibble: 60,447 x 2 #>    value datetime_utc        #>    <dbl> <dttm>              #>  1 8.85  2010-01-01 00:00:00 #>  2 7.21  2010-01-01 00:00:00 #>  3 6.31  2010-01-01 00:00:00 #>  4 4.81  2010-01-01 00:00:00 #>  5 3.53  2010-01-01 00:00:00 #>  6 2.38  2010-01-01 00:00:00 #>  7 1.85  2010-01-01 00:00:00 #>  8 1.04  2010-01-01 00:00:00 #>  9 0.96  2010-01-01 00:00:00 #> 10 0.879 2010-01-01 00:00:00 #> # ... with 60,437 more rows

Download 'TWDB' Historical Bay and Estuary Freshwater Inflow Data — download_coastal_hydrology
text: geoid character, required. resample character, optional. default, data returned daily interval. Specify one c("month", "year") get monthly yearly summed values. opts list curl options passed crul::HttpClient()

title: Download 'TWDB' Coastal Measurement Data — download_coastal_site_data
text: station character, required. parameter character, required. start_date character, required. Format must yyyy-mm-dd. end_date character, required. Format must yyyy-mm-dd. binning character. One "mon", "day", "hour". Default "day" opts list curl options passed crul::HttpClient()

title: Download 'TWDB' Lake Evaporation and Precipitation Data — download_lep
text: quad required character. TWDB quad number. start_date required character. Start date data. Specified 4-digit year 2-digit month. YYYY-MM end_date required character. End date data. Specified 4-digit year 2-digit month. YYYY-MM opts list curl options passed crul::HttpClient()
